result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Harrington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect at the rate of 25% of funds.  Balance to be paid  by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms; he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Harrington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant with copy of the court's order dated 12/1/14.
Defendant's pro se request for eligibility for earned release program.

Order on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program is DENIED.  Court finds the defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program because the court already made this determiantion at sentencing and delines to change it.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's motion for eligibility for substance abuse program.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (16 pages) commencing JULY 11, 2014 received and filed.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 7 years with 3 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James E Toran in court.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Toran is not available on 6-12-14 and is asking to adjourn the plea.  Court grants motion.  Court orders Attorney Toran to notify the defendant with a copy to the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James E Toran.  William Levins for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James E Toran.  William Levins for Meagan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James E Toran.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael Harrington in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Michael Harrington in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
